title: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When executing the ShiftLeft command after replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the two lines are visually indented the same, the text does not shift correctly. It is unclear how the behavior should be specified, but in the first scenario, it appears that the second line should be shifted left, and the first line should be shifted left at least up to the space character to align with the second line. However, currently, even with the stray space, the text does not shift.
EB: After replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces to visually align the two lines, executing the ShiftLeft command should correctly shift the text. In the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left, and the first line should be shifted left up to the space character to align with the second line. Having a stray space should not affect the shifting behavior.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces to visually align the two lines.
2. Execute the ShiftLeft command.
Expected: The text should shift correctly with the second line shifted left and the first line shifted left up to the space character, aligning with the second line.
Actual: The text does not shift correctly, even if there is a stray space, making it unclear why the text won't shift.
